name: Grand Sirenis Riviera Maya Hotel & Spa

reviews.text: What can i say about Grand Sirenis Riviera Maya? Well, first of all, the shuttle took over 2 and a half hours to get to our resort which was too long for us. Especially for us who arrived in Cancun at 9pm, we didn't end up arriving at the resort till after 1130! The check-in was not too bad. We all received a welcome drink which was a nice gesture. The first night we arrived, it was pretty chilly so make sure you bring a light sweater. We wanted to go back to the room to freshen up before we went to the buffet to eat something but they told us that the bags wouldn't arrive in our room for at least another half an hour so we decided to go up to check out the food selection. When we arrived at the buffet, there wasn't a huge selection of food. We had to wait for the chef to make some pasta and some pizza for us. Overall, the food is quite salty so be prepared to drink lots of water or alcoholic beverages.
reviews.title: hmmmm

reviews.text: Rooms:
reviews.title: The best trip I have ever taken

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were amazing big. We had 2 double size bed which were hard to sleep on. The first night, the hot water wasn't working properly. There was 3 of us in the room and luckily, i was the last one to shower and the hot water started working when it was my turn. Everyday, our room was spotless clean and they would make these wonderful animal shape design towels on the bed which was a nice gesture.
reviews.title: Our Best Holiday Yet!!!!!

reviews.text: Room Service:
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.text: Be prepare to wait a long time for your food to arrive. We order room service at around 6pm and the food never arrived. We had to cancel room service at around 745 as we had made dinner reservations at 8. So overall experience with room service 0 out of 5.
reviews.title: fantastic, weather was great, 1 concierge,Rickcado, he was very helpful

reviews.text: -The beach is nice for snorkeling.(only)
reviews.title: Just inform You - and You have to decide.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -from14 days stay we could sleep just 2 nights. loud drunken people returning to their rooms at 3 am. , banging their doors, screaming ......
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: -the bathroom was smelly
reviews.title: pro's and con's

reviews.text: - Do not touch the telephone in your room !!!! They say -it is free, but it is not !!! It is free if you are calling to your neighbor inside this hotel But if you are calling to your friends, who live in a condo 5 min. away form this hotel - you pay 3$ (dollars) per min.If somebody calls and keeps silence - you are pay for it !!!
reviews.title: Good but NOT a 5 star!! The true low down on this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -food was OK. Some days it was good, some days it was oversolty.
reviews.title: loved it! loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Grand Sirenis Mayan Riviera Mexico from May 21-May 28. Our honeymoon was wonderful. We could not ask for better service or more beautiful amenities.
reviews.title: Honeymoon in Paradise

reviews.text: The resort was very large offering a wide variety of pools, restaurants and activities. The food was for the most part very good. We would recommend the Cajun and Brazilian restaurants to other travellers as the meals we had there were absolutely delicious. The only dissapointment we had in regards to dinners was the lobster gala buffet night, we expected more choice of lobster but there were only half lobster tails available.
reviews.title: Stay Away !!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach is beautiful and is quite breathtaking, the water is rocky for the first 3-5 feet but then is perfectly fine. Tropical fish swim around you in these clear blue waters.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort, Amazing Vacation

likes.liked: — Beautiful hotel, great beach, amazing snorkeling

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The accomodations were amazing, with beautiful rooms with modern design and efficient staff who always left our rooms clean neat and tidy.
reviews.title: Cant wait to go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our vacation at the Grand Sirenis is one that we will always remember and we would definitely encourage other travellers to visit this resort
reviews.title: Diving was Fun!

likes.liked: — the open, airy and clean surroundings helps one relax and enjoy
likes.disliked: — septic odors around and in the specialty restaurants, also some off-color entertainment

reviews.text: THE BAD: Kiddie club not great. Food SUCKS!! Been to Mexico 5 times...by far, the worst food ever! Need water shoes to get into ocean--very rocky entrance. Lobby is the plainest we've ever seen.
reviews.title: Zen-style hotel; not 5 star!

reviews.text: THE GOOD: Rooms are spacious and gorgeous. Beach is gorgeous, once you get past the rocks. Friendly staff. Well-divided. Nice coffee shop.
reviews.title: Wonderful Resort - Please read this review

reviews.text: OVERALL: I would not go back to this hotel because the food was terrible. My children (4 and 7) ate nothing all week, and we got by on fruits. The fish is cooked in so much oil and strong spices, that it doesn't taste like fish anymore! Other than the food, we had a great time.
reviews.title: GREAT VACATION RESORT-----FUN FUN

reviews.text: Please take the time to read this review. My husband and I travel to Mexico frequently; I believe we have a good idea of excellence and value. We decided to include our two teenage sons on this trip. We were looking for a place to relax that had a great beach, good food, activities for the kids and quiet areas for adults needing a break from the "world" for a week for a fair price. Yes, you get what you pay for. In this case I think we got excellent value for our money.
reviews.title: Nice Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: TRANSPORTATION: I booked us a private tranfser through Cancun Transfers. WORTH EVERY PENNY! They were waiting for us outside the airport, as promised, with a comfortable Suburban and cold beers, water, soda. I highly recommend doing this. We have used transportation "free" through Apple, Funjet, etc in past and the stress that comes with that, plus the stopping at other resorts along the way isn't worth it. Book a private transfer, you will not regret it.
reviews.title: Our honest opinion...Practically Perfect

reviews.text: My wife and I along with 4 friends stayed at the Sirenis Nov.26-Dec.3 and had a wonderful time. Check-in was quick and 2 of the 3 couples had rooms available at check-in around noon. We were all in the closest building - ACAT - to the lobby which for us, was the best building to be in. We were close to the buffet and the a la carte restaurants, lobby bar in the evening & the entertainment complex.
reviews.title: Good Time At The Grand Sirenis

reviews.text: The rooms are large, and the water pressure was always great and lots of really hot water. We enjoyed the coffee & tea making in the room & the large jub of water in the bar fridge, along with the soda, beer and small bottles of water.
reviews.title: do not bother me

reviews.text: I snorkelled every day at least once, sometimes twice and saw a lot of fish. Take a banana in the water with the skin on & dole out a little here and there, and you will be swarmed by one specific type of fish. We saw all kinds of tropical colored fish from 1" to perhaps 22 '' or so. On the last day we saw a sea turtle about 2.5 feet long and a spotted ray with a tail about 4' long, both swimming which we followed for about a minute or so. We had previously seen a ray in the sand on the bottom as well as a small eel about 3' long & perhaps only 1" in diameter. It really looked like a snake.
reviews.title: Tropical Paradise

reviews.text: The food was fine at the buffets, and a few nights they had theme nights. We enjoyed the Asian which had Japanese, Indian etc type dishes. We visited 4 a la cartes with the Cajun being the best - my rib steak was to die for. The next night we tried the steak house and it was a disaster - my rib steak was overdone but I ate it, my wife's was full of grissle, and 2 of 3 T-bones couldn't be cut. When the waiter asked how we were doing, we explained the meat was tough and not very good - moments later he returned with the maitre d' and then he left to return with the chef.. They offered to prepare another meal but we didn't bother. We did talk to some people who had a great dinner at the steak house, so perhaps we just got bad cuts of meat. In the Italian restaurant 2 of us orderd the lemon chicken and it came with 2 thighs & a drumette with the bone in. I didn't expect bone-in chicken at a gourmet type restaurant. The Japanese restaurant was good, but they need to use a little less soy when cooking. The chicken was tender though. We also heard from others that the Brazilian restaurant was very good.
reviews.title: The warmest place on Earth...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bar service on the beach, around the pools, in the lobby and in the entertainment building was reasonably good. The girls work very hard and have a lot of ground to cover, so sometimes it may take a while before they return with your drinks. I generally got my own drinks with the exception of the entertainment building.
reviews.title: Very enjoyable stay

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel during Thanksgiving. The resort is excellent. We traveled there with our 2 year-old daughter and another family with two kids (a 2 year-old and a 7 year-old). It was a lot of fun. From our check-in to our check-out the services was great we we had no majors complaints. The hotel is far from the airport, it takes well over an hour to get there. Good thing is that it is not far from Tulum.
reviews.title: Excellent rooms. Great resort.

reviews.text: The shows are nice to watch. The food was okay. It was not the best we had in Cancun. The Brazilian restaurant was disappointing, we were expecting some good "churrasco" but that was no Brazilian food (we are Brazilian, we know it...). The Japanese restaurant, on the other hand, was excellent!
reviews.title: Decent - wouldn't go back though

reviews.text: The pools are large and nice and they have a lazy river which is lots of fun. Drinks are watered down as in most Cancun resorts. You always have the option of drinking the beer from the room though, which is bottled. The rooms, by the way, are the high point of this resort. They are large and comfortable. The only low point is that they accommodate couples and families in the same buildings. While couples get back from parties late and wake up late, families usually go to bed earlier and wake up earlier. In other words, the hallways are noisy late at night and early in the morning.
reviews.title: Good Value for our Cost!

reviews.text: The beach is too rocky. However, there are some excellent spots in between the rocks for snorkeling. We were able to see lots of colorful fishes right there. I recommend that one bring some beach shoes though, mainly for the kids. The kids club is fine and well located, right next to the beach. We used the babysitting services one night and it was great as well.
reviews.title: The good, the bad and the ugly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I definitely recommend this hotel for families and couples without kids. Not sure about single people looking for partying though, as the hotel is far from everything.
reviews.title: Grand Sirenis Needs Work!!

reviews.text: Upon arrival you are surprised more and more and this is not such a good thing as they say. Americans are few and far between, mostly Spanish, Mexican, French, German and Canadians – all of who don’t seem too endeared to Americans.
reviews.title: Upon arrival you are surprised more and more-

likes.liked: — It was clean, the rooms were open and the water was clear and warm.
likes.disliked: — The way you felt, like you did nto belong and they could care less, yes, they fixed problems, but there was just an awkward feeling to the resort, more eourpean than american.

reviews.text: When you pull up the resort is attractively welcoming. But then it begins, if they can find your room and then they try to put in rooms that don’t have views and are miles from anything.
reviews.title: Mold

reviews.text: Finally once you negotiate your room and get there it is really odd. You have to put your key (which is flat and small) in a slot in the wall to turn everything on, and the air-conditioning you can not adjusted - it is preset.
reviews.title: Nice resort has its problems. Have an open mind.

likes.liked: — The colors of the room and openness and the shower.
likes.disliked: — The toilet, the contant tipping and the feel that all they cared about was our money.

reviews.text: It is clean, but o-p-e-n so leave your modesty at home.
reviews.title: Good and bad - it is what you make it~

likes.liked: — The views and the climate - it was warm, sunny and the water was blue and clear.
likes.disliked: — The staff, the food was average but decent, the lack of lights to see at night, the feeling of desolation at night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is large and open and nicely modern and very neutral and soothing. The staff is there - in body, they speak limited English, but as long as you tip they seem to understand you better.
reviews.title: Hola!, hola!, hola!

likes.liked: — ocean view room, CLEANLINESS, friendly helpful staff and other guests

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went there with my husband and 2 of our friends. While we had a great time, the food was not 5 star. Not bad, but not great either. The entertainment was ok. The Lion King was hilarious. Kudos to the grass! The rooms were spacious and had all the ammenitites, but they were a little older looking than I expected (paint peeling, nail holes in the crackfill visible, etc). The staff were great. The beach was amazing. As were the iguanas. The pools were great and the mixed drinks were awesome. Not watered down at all like I read in another review. Maybe the staff felt those people had already had enough? Ours were a little strong on occasion. We had a good time walking the grounds and on the lazy river. The view from our balcony was spectacular! We got upgraded to an ocean view upon arrival. Sweet. The whole $100 gift certificate thing seems like a scam though. It's for couples and they want you to attend a presentation about their travel club. They have hotels in different areas and with their club you save slightly and get a few perks. Assuming you only go to their resorts. All in all, I would go back. It's very clean and it's a great family oriented resort. There is no topless sunbathing so you don't have to worry about old, saggy body parts everywhere you look.
reviews.title: Great trip with a few minor issues.

reviews.text: My girlfriends and I went for a short girls trip...about 3 days and four nights...and we got what we paid for, which wasnt much. Here are my complaints. OUr room smelled musty and felt like we were sleeping in a basement. When we complained they did nothing to fix the problem...Instead someone came to wipe down the walls at 9pm in the evening when we were trying to sleep. Then we were told we could only eat at 1 of the restaurants because we were only there for 3 days, this seemed a little dumb. The food was not that good for the rating it was given by apple vacation, who we book the trip. Then the night before we leave we get a letter, most likely because we complained about the room, that we need to schedule our bag pick up time at the concierge desk and we would receive $100 towards our bill. When we go to schedule our bag pick up, they said $100 was for couples only. Yet if they would have noticed we were all girls and check in under different names in the same room. They didn't seem to care about that mistake either. Now the positives....the general staff and bar staff were very nice and friendly. The spa was very clean and worth the time. The beach was very close, clean and nice. So if you are on a budget and dont care about food, or sleeping in a musty room then its ok. I will have to say that I will not be returning to this resort.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for.

reviews.text: We stayed at the Coba from March 20-27, 2010. Bus ride from airport was fine, lots to see and the ice cold Corona they serve didn't hurt either. Arrived and were checked in through the Premier lobby which was quick and painless. They give you a map when you check in KEEP IT. It was our lifesaver for the first few days.
reviews.title: Bigger is always better!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm not usually a fan of large resorts and this was one, but I was really impressed. Everyone commented on the impecable grounds - and they were right on the money. We went to the beach the first day, and stuck to the pools for the remainder. Quite a bit of rock and corral in sections, so if you are a beach person take water shoes or sandals you will need them. Pools were great, stuck to the quiet pool and chairs were pretty easy to come by.
reviews.title: Loved it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Took the transit bus into Playa Del Carmen one afternoon- watch out for the taxi drivers at the resort, they are similar to organ harvesters! Trying to get you into the cabs( $30 each way minimum) versus the bus ($3 each way maximum). They are 15 passenger vans which take you down town or to Tulum ( well the one we went on did). Hit up Fifth Street in the town, but it is similar to a flea market type shopping area. Long street with everything from high end boutiques to local's selling wares. You cannot barter in most shops, fixed pricing. However, there are little alleys along the way that have locals selling the same things which you can barter for.
reviews.title: Good times!
A pretty good resort
reviews.text: Was there between June 9 - 16th. This is a great resort, one of the main reason I picked the resort is because it is new (just opened Oct 2006) and it is a 5 star place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food:
reviews.title: Unforgetable!

likes.liked: — everything...especially tennis courts and the tenis pro

reviews.text: The food is pretty good overall, I was with Air Transat and they offer 4 a-la carte for the week which is great, only really at the buffet 2.5 nights (the first night we arrived, it was more like a snack as it was late). I did go to the Friday gala buffet with the lobster, yeah, it is a bit chewy but it is nevertheless lobster. I think the problem is the fact it is overcooked, but not a lot you can do. The quality of the food is decent (Caribbean standard) but I find that the selection is somewhat limited. I did the following a-la carte, Japanese was surprisingly good. Coming from Toronto where there are quite a few teppanyaki restaurants, this is pretty decent for Mexico standard. They actually offer real sashimi and I wasn't sick eating it afterward and they gave you a lot of meat. I also had the Mexican restaurant, the meal is so-so, the Italian was alright, the appetizer was quite good but the main dish was only so-so cause I didn't went with pasta, probably should have stick with pasta. The stick house is decent, probably some of the best beef I have tasted in the Caribbean which doesn't say a lot cause quality of beef there isn't great, but it was alright. I actually enjoy the coffee shop, it was kind of neat they had a coffee shop so you can go for something after dinner.
reviews.title: Forget the old reviews

reviews.text: Accommodations:
reviews.title: Fun Time

reviews.text: I was lucky and got a room with the hole in the wall between the bed and bath. It is somewhat neat, the room is quite big and very comfortable. There was half a day I was force to stay in the room due to a long rain storm but I never felt crammed. Bottom line is, the room is new and clean and really can't ask for anything more. Plenty of water, pop and beer, never had to ask for extra. I had an ocean view room, not much of a view but still nice to see the ocean.
reviews.title: Excellent time at the Grand Sirenis

likes.disliked: — Room was kind of musty, bring an air freshener

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Husband and I stayed from Mar 23-30, and had a wonderful vacation!! There where a lot of Students seeing it was Spring Break which made things crazy at night. Entertainment was good but it could have been more interactive. There where guests of all ages and there was always something to do! There was a lot to choose from with the buffets. Cajun Rest. was okay. Steakhouse was very good. Japanese was very good and our favorite. Food Service Staff was usually attentive, Bar Staff was quick, friendly and never cheap with the alcohol especially if you gave tips. Conceirge was not our favorite, each day we got bugged with letters to check out their Vacation Premium Packages. Booking Day Trips: Our first full day we booked with Best Day rather than Transat because of the difference in price. When we went for our resort briefing with Transat just after booking with Best Day they discouraged and alluded to possible problems and scams with signing with Best Day ... this made us worried seeing we already paid to go and could nto get our money back. Our only complaint with Best Day was before we went to Tulum we got taken to Lapis (a jewelery store) and this was not on the agenda nor of any interest to us. We wanted to see Tulum and not buy jewelery. Our second day trip we booked with Transat .... not impressed with them at all! 1st complaint was that they did not have enough cash to give us back our change and said they would give it to us later .... we never saw it. 2nd complaint was once we arrived to Xcaret we had to wait at least an hour and a half before we could go into the park because we had to wait for another bus to arrive and then the guide tried selling us camera's and suncreen then wait for him to go pick up the wristbands, coming home we had to go to several other resorts to do drop offs. The Xcaret trip from Transat was $23.00 more a person, than what Best Day offered it for. We actually preferred Best Day for booking day trips.
reviews.title: The perfect vacation with just a few complaints!!

reviews.text: Check in was very welcoming and very quick! Our fridge was restocked daily.
reviews.title: Great time at Grand Sirenis

reviews.text: Our biggest complaint about this resort was we booked our lugguage pickup and wakeup call and never got any of it. We were very glad that we decided to set the alarm just in case. The bellboy was to arrive at our room for 6am for pickup and at 6:05 we decided to take our own luggage and walk to the lobby fpr check out. We met up with a worker who offered to take our luggage for us which was good.
reviews.title: Absolutely loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did have a wonderful time at the resort and would go back even though there were some issues. The snorking was fantastic on the beach. The jacuzzi was great but took forever to fill. The Hydromassage shower didn't work properly, the bed was not the most comfortable and the pillows not the best. The room was nice but not a 5* rating. The Coffee Shop was great!! Everyone is differerent, but this is our opinion of our experience.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: My family and I went to the Grand Sirenis over my spring break. It was my parents (40's) me (20's) and my little brother (12) and we all loved our stay at the grand sirenis!. They gave us 2 rooms for 4 people, and one was even ready on arrival (12 pm) even through check in isn't until 3! the mini fridge is stocked with pop, water, and beer and on our first day we even got complementary champagne and fruit plates delivered to our rooms. they did everything to make us feel welcome!
reviews.title: Beach and Pools were the best, but definitely not five star rated!

reviews.text: Just returned from 8 days at the Grand Sirenis Riviera Maya. Overall I really loved this resort. Stayed in building 1900 and had a fantastic, beachfront, full oceanview room. (Definitely worth the extra money!) Yes, the cut-out in the bathroom wall is weird but I loved it as you could see the ocean from anywhere in the room. What I found annoying was the uncomfortable toilet seat! However, the jetted tub and shower made up for it. The room was very spacious and air conditioning worked great. Maid service was very good and they did an excellent job cleaning the room. Staff were all very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Loved this resort

likes.liked: — Oceanfront/view room, snorkelling, beaches and pools.

reviews.title: Hated the Sirenis
reviews.text: I loved the character of the beaches. Not your long stretch of white powder sand Carribean beach... rather more course sand, small coves and rock formations. Made for nice snorkelling and calm waters for swimming. I would recommend wearing water shoes. Never had trouble finding a quiet place to relax on the beach or at one of the pools. It helped that it was low-season and the resort was not very full. The grounds are beautiful and will be spectacular once the young foilage has matured.
I am not a huge drinker but did enjoy the Mohitos. Also became addicted to the drinks from the Health Bar. Make sure to try them!
reviews.title: Grand it certainly is

reviews.text: Issues: Food was mediocre. The buffet food was edible but not very good. Food was tastier at the pool restaurant but unfortunately it closed at 5 pm. Room service food was hit and miss and, although it was always delivered within half an hour, it was generally awful. Specialty restaurants were better but I was not able to get all my bookings. I expect much better food quality from a 5 star resort. I have stayed at many all-inclusives and the food here was the worst. However, you will never go hungry.
reviews.title: Nice modern hotel

reviews.text: This is actually 2 resorts combined into one. The buildings are quite spread out over the resort which means lots of walking. There are a lot of large cracks, spaces between stones in pathways, etc. which could be a potential hazard for some. Walkways and tile floors become very slippery when damp or wet. So just be careful when walking around.
reviews.title: Great Family Vacation

reviews.text: This hotel has much to offer, but this is no 5 star hotel.
reviews.title: Good - Not a 5 star even by Mexico standards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pro's
reviews.title: Grand Sirenis Riviera Maya - Great Vacation but maybe not 5 Star Quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1 - Pools - (Lots of them to choose from, fun activities)
reviews.title: Great Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2 - Beach - ( Beautifull)
reviews.title: Okay, but noisy rooms, great snorkeling

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3 - Service - (Most of the staff was very eager to serve assuming you tip every time.)
reviews.title: Had a good time but not great

aka: Grand Sirenis Riviera Maya Hotel And Spa
